translation.en: [reporter] The great Seahawk racing team. How do you look forward to the race today?
translation.ko: 그레이트 시호크 경주팀 오늘 경주가 어떨 것 같으세요?

translation.en: -We'll see when we get out there. -Don't believe anything he says.
translation.ko: - 겨뤄 보면 알겠죠 - 이 친구 말 믿지 마세요

translation.en: Who just came into this picture here is the one and only Sal Magluta,
translation.ko: 그 유명한 살 마글루타 씨가 방금 등장했습니다

translation.en: the man who is the driving force behind the Seahawk race team.
The way it's going, you may end up with a third national championship
somewhere along the way.
Well, I'll take it.
Why not?
Three in a row's not too bad. They come in threes.
Willy Falcon, driver of Seahawk.
Willy Falcon looks confident to me today.
-I wish him the best of luck. -Thank you.
[announcer] There's the yellow flag and the flare. They're now on the course.
translation.ko: 노란 깃발과 조명탄이 보이죠 다들 코스로 나왔습니다

translation.en: Right off the bat, look at these two cats going at it. A drag race, if you will.
translation.ko: 시작하자마자 이 두 팀이 가속 경주를 벌이네요

translation.en: Willy Falcon makes a bid for the lead
over Sal Magluta.
-[engine whines] -Uh-oh! Sal Magluta spins out!
You're gonna see the number 20, Willy Falcon,
go by and now he has moved up.
Whoa! And we're starting to fly.
Jesse James has taken over the lead.
Willy Falcon… He's finding some extra power.
Whoa! Seahawk has taken over the lead.
A little happiness on the part of the navigator
as he kinda jumps up and down.
[commentator] He knows.
[announcer laughs] They're waving out there.
Look at the excitement in that crew now.
What a thrill for this crew to come here as the second boat of the Seahawk team.
[commentator] Look who's excited, their teammates who broke early.
translation.ko: 시호크 팀에선 이진이잖아요 일찌감치 탈락한 팀원들도 기뻐하고 있습니다

translation.en: Look at Sal Magluta do a dance.
[announcer] This team will be celebrating for three weeks, I think.
translation.ko: 축하 파티를 3주 동안 하지 않을까 싶어요

translation.en: [reporter] Willy Falcon and Sal Magluta, Los Muchachos, "the boys,"
translation.ko: 해상 모터보트 챔피언이자 '로스 무차초스'라 불리는 윌리 팔콘과 살 마글루타가

translation.en: the offshore powerboat champions indicted for trafficking
translation.ko: '로스 무차초스'라 불리는 윌리 팔콘과 살 마글루타가 20억 달러 상당의 코카인 75t을

translation.en: more than 75 tons of cocaine worth an estimated two billion dollars.
translation.ko: 20억 달러 상당의 코카인 75t을 밀매한 혐의로 기소됐습니다 연방 당국에 따르면

translation.en: Making it what federal authorities say was the largest drug case in history.
translation.ko: 밀매한 혐의로 기소됐습니다 연방 당국에 따르면 역사상 가장 큰 마약 사건입니다

translation.en: Witness assassinations,
unprecedented corruption of the American justice system.
translation.ko: 전례 없는 미국 사법 제도의 부패

translation.en: Few people in South Florida have been untouched
by the saga of Willy Falcon and Sal Magluta
that has taken these Cuban exiles from dropouts
translation.ko: 1980년대 코카인 카우보이의 전형이 된 쿠바 망명자 윌리 팔콘과 살 마글루타의 이야기에

translation.en: to the epitome of the Cocaine Cowboys of the 1980s.
translation.ko: 쿠바 망명자 윌리 팔콘과 살 마글루타의 이야기에 연루되지 않은 사람은 남부 플로리다에 없습니다

translation.en: ♪ I've been processed, packaged Delivered in bricks ♪ ♪ I've been cut, cooked Chopped and whipped ♪
♪ Like perico, yeyo Snow, blow, and cane ♪
♪ They'll kick in your door Like Bruce Lee ♪
♪ Just to have An intimate love affair with me ♪
♪ I corrupt governments Yeah, that's me ♪
♪ I built the streets, listen closely ♪
♪ Deal, cow-, extort, -boys ♪
♪ For the love of the blood sport ♪
[woman] I was born in New York City.
My parents are Cuban.
And in 1971, we moved to Miami.
[reporter] This is Southwest 8th Street or as the Cubans call it,
8th Street of the Southwest. Little Havana's main street.
translation.ko: 사우스웨스트의 8번 거리인 이곳은 리틀 아바나의 중심가죠

translation.en: The Tamiami Trail now symbolizes an economic miracle
translation.ko: 타미아미 트레일은 이제 마이애미의 쿠바 난민들이 불러온

translation.en: brought about by Miami's Cuban refugees.
translation.ko: 타미아미 트레일은 이제 마이애미의 쿠바 난민들이 불러온 경제적 기적을 상징합니다

translation.en: [Bonachea] I was 15 and a half. It was summer, and I needed a job.
My mom said, "Next to Publix is a bakery, a Jewish-Cuban bakery
translation.ko: 엄마가 퍼블릭스 옆에 있는 유대 겸 쿠바 빵집에 가보라더군요

translation.en: with the rye bread, the pumpernickel."
And then they had guayabas, and all that kinda stuff.
So I said, "Okay." I went over there.
I met Sal's mom and dad, and uncles. They all owned the bakery.
translation.ko: 거기서 빵집 소유주인 살의 부모님과 삼촌을 만났어요

translation.en: The next day, I met Sal.
I just didn't like him. I thought, "Who is this guy with attitude here?"
translation.ko: 마음에 안 들었어요 태도가 너무 건방졌거든요

translation.en: He was supposed to be working in the back.
But he would set up a stool where I worked in the counter
translation.ko: 제가 일하는 카운터에 의자를 갖다 놓고는

translation.en: and he'd sit there and watch because I wore this little pink uniform.
translation.ko: 거기 앉아 지켜보더군요 제가 입은 분홍색 유니폼이

translation.en: It was really short. He would sit there and wait for me to bend over.
translation.ko: 무척 짧았거든요 제가 허리를 구부리길 기다린 거죠

translation.en: He spent three weeks trying to get my phone number.
I said, "I'll give you one number per week."
translation.ko: 한 주에 번호 하나씩 알려주겠다고 했어요

translation.en: I gave him one number until we went down the line to the seven numbers,
then he got my phone number.
Most of the time we went out, he didn't have a penny to his name.
He says, "One day I'm gonna have
all the money in the world. I'll buy any car I want."
translation.ko: 돈을 많이 벌어 갖고 싶은 차를 살 거라길래

translation.en: I was like, "Great."
Sal was always up to no good. He was mischievous.
translation.ko: 살은 정직과는 거리가 멀었죠 나쁜 짓을 많이 했어요

translation.en: He had just gotten kicked out of Miami High School.
So he ended up in my high school.
And I would sit and do his homework, so he wouldn't get in trouble.
translation.ko: 선생님께 혼날까 봐 제가 숙제를 해주곤 했어요

translation.en: His mother and father don't speak any English.
translation.ko: 살의 부모님은 영어를 전혀 못 하세요

translation.en: And he would take his report card home and his mother would say,
translation.ko: 살이 성적표를 가져가면 어머님이 이러시곤 했죠

translation.en: "What does that F stand for?"
"That F stands for Felicidad."
Felicidad means "happy." He got a good grade.
And they believed it all these years,
all those F's, that Sal was doing great in school.
translation.ko: F를 보고 학교에서 잘하는 줄 아셨죠

translation.en: Because he was getting Felicidad, Felicidad, Felicidad. [laughs]
When he wasn't even attending class.
He would date at least ten girls at the same time before I found out.
And he got one of the girls pregnant.
I wouldn't date him anymore after that.
[man] Gloria and Manolo Magluta were my parents' best friends.
translation.ko: 살의 부모님은 제 부모님과 단짝 친구셔서

translation.en: To me, they were like my parents.
So Sal was like my cousin. Actually, like my brother.
Sal's parents, they owned a bakery shop and they worked very hard,
translation.ko: 살의 부모님은 빵집을 운영하는 성실한 노동자셨어요

translation.en: extremely hard-working people. They were in church two, three times a week.
translation.ko: 정말 열심히 일하셨죠 교회엔 매주 2, 3번씩 나가고요

translation.en: Here were these amazing parents, but they weren't there all day long.
translation.ko: 그렇게 훌륭한 분들이셨지만 집을 많이 비웠어요

translation.en: I look back now,
and that probably started to become the formation
of what happened in Sal's life.
[Bonachea] Every night, Sal would call me. We would chat and he'd read me the Bible.
translation.ko: 살이 매일 밤 전화해 대화도 나누고 성경도 읽어 줬어요

translation.en: Sal's main concern, always,
was whether he was going to go to heaven or not.
translation.ko: 자신이 천국에 갈 수 있느냐는 거였죠

translation.en: He said to me one time that, if you repent,
no matter what bad deeds you do, that you will go to heaven.
So I think in his mind, it's like, "I can do anything I want
translation.ko: 살은 이렇게 생각했을 거예요 원하는 대로 다 해도

translation.en: as long as later I repent, and I feel bad for what I did,
translation.ko: 나중에 잘못을 뉘우치면 하나님이 용서해 주실 테니

translation.en: and then God will forgive me and I will go to heaven."
translation.ko: 나중에 잘못을 뉘우치면 하나님이 용서해 주실 테니 천국에 갈 수 있다고요

translation.en: I think that things started to go wrong for Sal.
He was hanging around the wrong crowd.
[Bonachea] Sal's best friend during that time was Willy Falcon.
translation.ko: 그 당시 살은 윌리 팔콘과 가장 친했어요

translation.en: Willy was intimidating,
where Sal wasn't.
Sal was the peacemaker.
Willy was more of the brawler. Like, you know, "I'm in your face."
He had this expression of going like this all the time,
"What you gonna do about it?"
At that time, I had no idea that they were drug dealers.
We all shared one thing. We were poor and didn't wanna stay poor.
translation.ko: 우린 공통점이 있었죠 더는 가난하게 살기 싫었어요

translation.en: Willy and Sal started off as small-time, little pot pushers out of Miami High.
translation.ko: 윌리와 살은 마이애미 고교에서 대마초 딜러로 시작했어요

translation.en: They sorta struggled, don't do well, end up being high school dropouts.
translation.ko: 학교에 적응하지 못해 결국 그만두고 말았죠

translation.en: [man] My sister-in-law's boyfriend introduced me to Willy.
translation.ko: 처제의 남자 친구가 윌리를 소개해 줬어요

translation.en: "Tony, why don't you give these guys a try?"
At that time, Willy was selling dime bags with Sal.
translation.ko: 그 당시 윌리와 살은 대마초를 1g씩 담아 팔았죠

translation.en: Willy was a jovial guy, very nice. Uh, not too smart.
translation.ko: 윌리는 유쾌했어요, 아주 상냥했죠 똑똑하진 않았지만요

translation.en: I knew his mother and his father and his brother, Taby.
translation.ko: 윌리의 부모님은 물론 남동생 타비와도 알고 지냈어요

translation.en: Willy and Salvador were always together. They were like family.
translation.ko: 윌리와 살바도르는 늘 함께였죠 가족 같았어요

translation.en: But really, Willy didn't know what the hell was going on.
How much money they had, he didn't know. That was all Sal.
translation.ko: 자기들 재산이 얼만지도 몰랐죠 살이 다 알아서 했어요

translation.en: Willy was always kept in the dark.
Willy was, for all intents and purposes, Sal's dummy.
I'd fly the marijuana from Colombia and I was selling it to them.
translation.ko: 전 콜롬비아에서 대마초를 가져와 그들에게 팔았습니다

translation.en: But then I stopped.
It's not enough money.
[Valdes] There was so many people in the marijuana business,
because it took so many people to handle one load.
translation.ko: 한 번 들이는 데 인력이 많이 필요했거든요

translation.en: Whereas in the cocaine, you can bring in 800, 1000 kilo.
Literally, I could handle that with four people.
[DeFede] They moved from marijuana to cocaine.
I wouldn't have said they were drug dealers.
They were buying ounces on the streets and reselling it.
translation.ko: 거리에서 몇g 사서 되파는 게 고작이었으니까요

translation.en: Sal was just a regular young guy doing a little hustle on the side.
translation.ko: 살은 그냥 거리에서 푼돈을 버는 평범한 젊은이였을 뿐

translation.en: You know, if anybody, I was a drug dealer, right?
I'm the one bringing in 800 kilos a month.
I think that Sal put two and two together.
My father started telling how I was always traveling.
translation.ko: 제 아버지가 살한테 제가 여행이 잦고

translation.en: and that I was putting a banana company together in Colombia.
translation.ko: 콜롬비아에서 바나나 회사를 차리고 있다고 했거든요

translation.en: Sal just said, "Impossible. I mean, Jorge is 21 years old,
translation.ko: 살이 그건 불가능하다고 했죠 제가 겨우 21살인데

translation.en: he's making a million dollars a month. He ain't selling bananas."
translation.ko: 매월 백만 달러를 벌고 있으니 바나나가 아니라고 했어요

translation.en: "Let me talk to your son. Tell him to give me a meeting."
I finally gave him a meeting.
I had about 15 minutes to meet with him. I was in a rush. He was at my office.
translation.ko: 제 사무실에서 15분쯤 봤을 거예요 제가 바빴거든요

translation.en: He said, "Give me a chance. I think I can sell some coke here and there."
translation.ko: 살이 코카인을 팔 수 있다면서 기회를 달라더군요

translation.en: I'm like, "Well, how much money do you have?"
And he's like, "I think ten or 20 thousand dollars."
I literally almost peed in my pants.
At that time, it was $42,000, in Miami, wholesale for a kilo of cocaine.
I didn't wanna insult him because I've always loved Sal, even today.
translation.ko: 살을 모욕하고 싶지 않았어요 지금도 그렇지만 살이 좋았거든요

translation.en: I'm like, "All right, let me see
if the opportunity arises because now, we really are committed somewhere else."
translation.ko: 지금은 다른 곳에 주력하고 있는데 기회가 생기는지 보자고요

translation.en: My handsome Latin friends, the brothers Falcon, Gus and Willy.
translation.ko: 저의 잘생긴 라틴계 친구인 구스와 윌리 팔콘 형제입니다

translation.en: [man] In about 1978, my older sister, China, she started dating Taby, Gustavo Falcon.
translation.ko: 1978년쯤 누나인 치나가 구스타보 팔콘과 사귀기 시작했죠

translation.en: As soon as she turned 18, my sister and Taby got married.
Through Taby, I met his older brother Willy Falcon.
translation.ko: 타비를 통해 그 형인 윌리 팔콘을 만났고

translation.en: And through Willy Falcon, I met his best friend, Sal Magluta.
translation.ko: 윌리 팔콘을 통해 그 단짝인 살 마글루타를 만났죠

translation.en: I grew up in Little Havana when we came from Cuba.
It was like the Cuban ghetto.
[reporter] Among Latins in South Florida, particularly Cubans,
translation.ko: 남부 플로리다의 라틴계 사람들 특히 쿠바인들 사이에는

translation.en: there is a lingual reference to different aspects of community life.
translation.ko: 다양한 측면의 공동체 생활을 위해 알아둬야 할 용어들이 있습니다

translation.en: Police are called la jara.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation is la federica.
And when talking about a gun, Latins say, la fuca.
[Rosello] My parents didn't know English. So it was hard for us growing up.
translation.ko: 부모님이 영어를 몰라서 우리가 자랄 때 쉽지 않았어요

translation.en: My dad had two jobs. He would leave at seven in the morning
and get back at ten o'clock at night.
I saw my dad working so hard.
translation.ko: 전 어릴 때 아버지가 일에 파묻혀 사는 걸 보면서

translation.en: That's not what I wanted to do when I was a kid growing up.
translation.ko: 전 어릴 때 아버지가 일에 파묻혀 사는 걸 보면서 저렇게 살기는 싫다고 생각했어요

translation.en: I didn't wanna have two jobs.
But now, I was Willy and Taby Falcon's little brother.
translation.ko: 그러던 중에 저는 윌리와 타비 팔콘의 동생이 됐죠

translation.en: I hung out with Taby, like, on a daily basis.
After school, I would go to their house. Willy's friends would come by.
translation.ko: 학교 끝나고 그들 집에 가면 윌리의 친구들이 오곤 했죠

translation.en: I would wash their cars and get paid 20 bucks.
translation.ko: 전 그들의 차를 닦으며 20달러를 벌곤 했어요

translation.en: Expensive Corvettes, Cadillacs, Porsches.
So on a Saturday and Sunday, I would make like $200 in two days.
translation.ko: 그렇게 토요일, 일요일 이틀 동안 200달러를 벌었어요

translation.en: My dad would make $200 probably in three weeks.
So, I'm like, "Oh, this is good," you know?
I mean, whatever they're doing, it's paying off.
translation.ko: 그들이 하는 게 뭐든 돈벌이가 됐으니까요

translation.en: A lot of Willy's friends, they would taunt me, you know?
translation.ko: 윌리의 친구들이 제 약을 올리곤 했어요

translation.en: They would go in and go, "Pegy, here look what I got in here."
translation.ko: 저한테 이랬죠 '페기, 여기 뭐가 있는지 봐'

translation.en: They opened the shoe box and it was all money, and I'm, like, "Damn." You know?
translation.ko: 그러면서 신발 상자를 여는데 다 돈이었어요, 얼마나 부럽던지

translation.en: Right then and there, I knew what they were doing. I knew it was drugs.
translation.ko: 그들이 마약을 판다는 걸 안 게 바로 그때예요

translation.en: The city of Miami in 1978 and 1979,
a number of narcotics detectives at that time had obtained permission
translation.ko: 1978년과 1979년 마이애미에서 다수의 마약 수사관이 주 법원 판사로부터 마약 밀매업자들과 관련된

translation.en: from a state court judge to conduct
translation.ko: 주 법원 판사로부터 마약 밀매업자들과 관련된

translation.en: a wiretap investigation involving a number of drug traffickers.
translation.ko: 도청 수사를 할 수 있는 허가를 받았어요

translation.en: This operation was coined Operation Video Canary.
[reporter] The state attorney's office got its first lead last August
when an informant led undercover agents to the 5th floor
translation.ko: 정보에 따라 비밀 요원들이 캐피털 은행 건물 5층으로

translation.en: of the Capital Bank Building.
[Valdes] Sal was dealing with this gentleman that had a office.
And the office was all wired.
That operation, Video Canary,
was the first time that they came into the radar.
All they know about Sal and Willy is that they were selling ounces or a kilo.
It wasn't no big amounts of anything.
That investigation was not centered on Falcon and Magluta.
translation.ko: 그 수사의 핵심은 팔콘과 마글루타가 아니었어요

translation.en: [reporter] More than 120 suspects were expected to be brought in,
43 of whom are from Dade County.
[Clark] Falcon and Magluta were among those arrested
and charged in the state system in Miami, Florida
with state drug trafficking charges.
[Valdes] When they got busted, I don't believe the government had any idea
translation.ko: 살과 윌리를 체포하긴 했지만 당시 정부는 그들의 실체를 몰랐죠

translation.en: what Sal and Willy were all about. They're clueless what's going on in Miami.
translation.ko: 살과 윌리를 체포하긴 했지만 당시 정부는 그들의 실체를 몰랐죠 마이애미 상황을 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Clark] They were given a probationary sentence of five years,
a special condition of which they serve 14 months.
What it was, it was like a joke.
It was like, "This is nothing. This is kiddy play."
translation.ko: 간지럽죠, 뭐 아무것도 아니잖아요 그 정도는 가뿐하죠

translation.en: [DeFede] Willy and Sal got out on bail.
But what their attorneys were also able to do,
was to keep the case on appeal for years.
The likelihood of them ever prevailing was nil.
However, this did buy them time.
And they continued to traffic in drugs pretty much unabated throughout the 1980s.
[DeFede] They were still out on the streets, selling cocaine,
and this began a real theme for them.
That they were almost untouchable. Like they were walking between raindrops.
translation.ko: 아무도 손을 못 댔거든요 어떤 제한도 받지 않았죠

translation.en: And that's really the story of Willy and Sal.
At that time, a load had come in and we were down to 30 kilos.
All of a sudden, we had these 30 kilos I had to get rid of
because the following day, I'm leaving for Europe.
translation.ko: 왜냐면 다음 날 제가 유럽에 가야 했거든요

translation.en: Sal comes over with Willy and I said, "You want a chance?"
translation.ko: 그래서 살과 윌리가 찾아왔길래 '기회를 줄까?'라고 물었죠

translation.en: And he's like, "Yeah, thanks." I said, "Okay, here it is, 30 kilos."
Sal did not wanna do it.
Sal didn't think they could sell 30 kilos of cocaine.
translation.ko: 그걸 팔 수 있다고 생각지 않았거든요

translation.en: He's like, "Oh, my God! No, too much." But Willy jumped up and he's like,
translation.ko: 양이 너무 많으니까요 윌리는 좋아 날뛰면서 대수롭지 않게 여겼고요

translation.en: "That's nothing."
translation.ko: 윌리는 좋아 날뛰면서 대수롭지 않게 여겼고요

translation.en: "Trust me. Don't worry. It's Miami, we'll figure it out."
And Sal looked at him like…
[chuckles] "You've probably been snorting a bit too much."
Sal's got more reservation about what he can do,
translation.ko: 살은 자신의 능력에 좀 더 회의적이었어요

translation.en: possibly because Willy knew more people than he did.
translation.ko: 왜냐면 윌리가 아는 사람이 더 많았거든요

translation.en: Willy was just the face.
He loved to brag. Not a lot of brains, but everybody loved Willy, right?
translation.ko: 뻐기는 걸 좋아했죠 똑똑하진 않지만 인기가 많았어요

translation.en: Thirty days later the guy came back. They had $1.2 million for him
translation.ko: 30일 후 돌아온 조지에게 그들은 120만 달러를 건넸어요

translation.en: in return for the 30 kilos that he had sold them.
They came with all the money. And I was very shocked.
"Hey, when can we have some more?"
[DeFede] There was never any discussion after that as to whether they could actually handle
translation.ko: 그날 이후 두 사람이 감당할 수 있는 양에 관한 논의는

translation.en: the amount the providers could give to them.
[Valdes] Sal got confidence quickly.
translation.ko: 살은 금세 자신감을 얻었죠 처음 할 땐 주저했는데

translation.en: When you try to do something the first time, you don't think you can.
translation.ko: 살은 금세 자신감을 얻었죠 처음 할 땐 주저했는데 막상 해보니 별것 아니란 걸 알 때가 있잖아요

translation.en: Once you do it, you're like, "That was not hard."
translation.ko: 막상 해보니 별것 아니란 걸 알 때가 있잖아요

translation.en: They went from selling grams, to selling 30 kilos.
translation.ko: 몇g을 팔던 두 사람이 30kg을 판 거예요

translation.en: How did these people go from party boy, to becoming a major drug lord,
translation.ko: 파티장에서 찔끔찔끔 팔다가 어떻게 거물 마약상이 돼서

translation.en: making a million dollars a month?
translation.ko: 매월 백만 달러를 벌게 된 걸까요?

translation.en: Very quickly.
Little did we begin to see that demand would explode and it was fast.
translation.ko: 수요가 그렇게 급증할 줄은 우리도 몰랐어요

translation.en: [DeFede] The demand was insatiable. It was like an eruption.
[reporter] Americans consume more than 50 tons of cocaine every year,
spending nearly $40 billion for the illicit drug.
translation.ko: 그 불법 마약에 거의 400억 달러를 쓰죠

translation.ko: 시작점인 캘리포니아엔 영화배우, 유명인, 가수가 있었죠

translation.en: New York City where you have nightclubs, where you have Wall Street.
What was Miami?
There was no night life. It was two, three little nightclubs of high school kids.
translation.ko: 유흥가도 없고, 고등학생이 가는 나이트클럽 2, 3개가 다였어요

translation.en: South Beach did not exist. To imagine selling 30 kilos in Miami, it's crazy.
translation.ko: 사우스 비치는 존재하지 않았고요 그런데 30kg을 팔았으니 엄청나죠

translation.en: Sal comes into the picture of Miami.
He starts bringing all his young friends around to go and party and to show off.
translation.ko: 젊은 친구들과 어울려 다니며 파티하고 으스댔죠

translation.en: Sal and Willy developed the Miami cocaine market.
translation.ko: 살과 윌리는 마이애미의 코카인 시장을 개척했어요

translation.en: They got a huge reputation very quick.
Success in any business venture involves elements of hard work as well as luck.
translation.ko: 어떤 사업에서든 성공하려면 노력과 운이 필요합니다

translation.en: Falcon and Magluta benefited from luck
and the misfortune of one of their colleagues, Jorge Valdes.
translation.ko: 동료인 조지 발데스의 불운이 호기로 작용했죠

translation.en: He was arrested and he received a sentence of between five and ten years.
But then he had to turn his business over to somebody.
When I got convicted, they let me out on bail. Logically,
translation.ko: 제가 유죄 판결을 받고 보석으로 풀려났어요, 논리적으로

translation.en: I didn't have anybody else to handle operation that I thought
could handle the level of what I was doing.
So I got together with Sal and I told him, I said,
"Here's my buyers in California."
And I introduced him to my connection in the Medellin cartel.
translation.ko: 그러곤 메데인 카르텔의 제 연줄을 소개해 줬습니다

translation.en: [Clark] This was the break that launched Falcon and Magluta into the big time,

Now they had unlimited access to large quantities of cocaine
translation.ko: 콜롬비아 카르텔이 미국까지 무사히 운반하는 한

translation.en: that the Colombian cartel needed to have transported successfully

translation.en: into the United States.
translation.ko: 제한 없이 사용할 수 있게 된 거죠

translation.en: Imagine if they thought selling 30 kilos was something crazy out of this world.
translation.ko: 상상해 보세요, 30kg을 어떻게 파느냐고 했던 그들이

translation.en: Suddenly now, they're going to be running an empire.
Man, next week, there's 800 kilos coming.
All they have to do is find a pilot with a plane.
[man] I had a part-time job doing banners
up and down Miami Beach.
And that paid $3 an hour.
I went to Miami High with Willy and Sal. We just became friends.
translation.ko: 마이애미 고등학교에서 윌리와 살을 만나 친구가 됐어요

translation.en: Years later, we started talking.
translation.ko: 얘길 시작한 건 몇 년 뒤였죠

translation.en: We discussed, what kind of plane would you use for smuggling?
I started doing some research as to what kind of plane, what kind of equipment.
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 비행기와 장비에 관해 검색해

translation.en: I said, "Look, this is what you need and this is how much it's gonna cost."
translation.ko: 어떤 게 필요하고 비용은 얼마인지 말해줬죠

translation.en: And he says, "Okay, well,
let's do it."
Everything was prepared, the Colombians were ready,
'cause they need a few days to clear the runways
between the army and the leftist guerrillas
and bring the merchandise to where it's supposed to be.
Opa Locka Airport was full of smugglers.
[Posada] Everybody there was working.
[Linero] Cuban smugglers walking around, all were wearing cowboy boots.
translation.ko: 쿠바 밀수업자들이 돌아다녔죠 다들 카우보이 부츠를 신고

translation.en: All were wearing beepers. All were wearing Rolex. All were wearing cowboy hats.
translation.ko: 호출기와 롤렉스 시계를 차고 카우보이모자를 쓰고요

translation.en: And I think that's where the "cocaine cowboys" came to be known as.
It was a uniform.
Going to Colombia, it was a ten-hour flight.
So we had about 400 gallons of fuel in about eight tanks.
I'm in a flying bomb.
In Colombia, it is illegal to fly a private airplane after five o'clock.
translation.ko: 콜롬비아에서는 5시 이후에 전용기를 조종하는 건 불법입니다

translation.en: So, basically, everybody knows that this plane that's flying at six o'clock
translation.ko: 그래서 6시에 하늘을 날고 있다면 그건 밀수업자 비행기란 걸

translation.en: is a smuggler plane.
You look down, everybody is giving you signals.
They're burning tires.
So you have to precisely be
where you need to be, or otherwise,
you're gonna die.
I made my approach and I'm pretty confident that I got the runway,
translation.ko: 제가 착륙해야 할 활주로를 찾아 접근하기 시작했어요

translation.en: which is not really a runway.
So, I landed,
get out, people start putting grass on top of the airplane and so on.
In the morning, we get to the plane,
and here comes these three or four Jeeps

translation.ko: 지프 3, 4대에 더플백이 가득했는데 가방 당 30에서 40kg의 코카인이 들어 있었어요

translation.en: Plane is loaded, ready to go.
Now, we're almost 1,500 pounds over the gross weight of the airplane.
"Are you out of your mind? This could not happen."
Well, it's happening, okay?
We were doing lines right on the top of the dashboard where the instruments are.
Some beautiful, big, thick lines of cocaine.
People fly high, you know? I can't understand that.
translation.ko: 약에 취해 비행하는 사람들이 난 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: [Linero] You need to be very aware of what's going on in the plane.
translation.ko: 비행기를 조종할 땐 정신을 바짝 차려야 하는데

translation.en: As I'm high and paranoid, I could feel a little change on the engine in my ass.
translation.ko: 저는 약에 취하면 작은 변화까지 다 감지해요

translation.en: If there was a vibration, I could look at the gauges
and see that this is okay and that's fine here.
I think that being high helped a lot.
He must have been out of his mind.
There was a time that I was making about one or two trips a month.
translation.ko: 그렇게 한 달에 한두 번 코카인을 실어 나른 적이 있어요

translation.en: We're talking about 800 keys a month.
I was basically making around 200 grand per trip.
Willy, he wanted me to go every week
translation.ko: 윌리는 매주 하자고 했지만 매주 투우를 하면 무사할 확률이

translation.en: but it's like, how many times can you go into bullfighting and not get hurt?
translation.ko: 윌리는 매주 하자고 했지만 매주 투우를 하면 무사할 확률이 얼마나 된다고 생각하세요?

translation.en: [Rosello] They used to bring the coke from Colombia to Freeport.
From Freeport, they would bring the coke to Miami in speedboats.
The guy on the boat was Juan Barroso,
that used to race with Seahawk. He used to bring in the coke.
translation.ko: 시호크 팀 소속으로 코카인을 들이는 일을 했죠

translation.en: Okay, now we have the smallest navigator in offshore racing,
translation.ko: 해상 경주에서 키가 가장 작은 항해사죠

translation.en: and it's Johnny "Recut." Here we go.
My name is Juan Barroso, right? They call me "Recut."
translation.ko: 제 이름은 후안 바로소입니다 다들 '리컷'이라고 부르죠

translation.en: Like if he was recut, you know, like if they cut him. [laughs]
[Linero] One time when he got in, Willy got a couple of phone books

translation.en: and put him on his seat with duct tape and he was screaming and yelling.
translation.ko: 테이프로 고정했어요 후안이 소리 지르고 난리였죠

translation.en: And we were all laughing.
As you can see, we standing up.
You know, we had to make a special booster for him, but he's learning very little.
translation.ko: 보조 의자까지 만들어 줬는데 후안의 실력이 늘지를 않네요

translation.en: He's learning by the time that he's got a big mouth.
Willy and me, we used to know each other from high school.
[Rosello] Willy says, "You have Recut in the boat, he probably weighs 80 pounds.
He's this short.
You won't get drag from the wind, so you'd get a little advantage."
translation.ko: 바람에 휘둘리지 않아 유리할 거라고 했어요

translation.en: We took our boat down to Nassau, and we took an aerodynamic.
translation.ko: 보트를 타고 공기역학을 이용해 나소까지 왔어요

translation.en: And the boat was running fast, but we needed a shorter navigator
translation.ko: 보트가 정말 빨리 달렸는데 키 작은 항해사를 구해

translation.en: so the air would pass through, so we had to get a shorter person.
translation.ko: 공기저항을 줄인 게 효과를 본 것 같아요

translation.en: How old are you?
-Eleven. -How old are you?
-Twenty-nine. -He's bigger than you?
He's a little bigger.
-You're full of shit. -[all laugh]
There was a guy that worked for him, Justo Jay.
We started talking and he tell me, "Hey, Willy wants to meet with you."
translation.ko: 얘기를 했는데 윌리가 절 찾는다는 거예요

translation.en: Willy told me, "We got some stuff that's coming through Freeport, Bahamas."
translation.ko: 윌리가 바하마 프리포트에서 물건을 실어 와야 하는데

translation.en: "Can you do it for me?" "Yeah."
It was the first load I did with cocaine with him.
I made like 250 grand.
In one night.
I would go down to Freeport. You go across the island.
Then he'd meet me with a little boat and he'd put the stuff in.
Outta there.
I go over by the Keys.
I saw people, they transported it and put it in trucks.
They bring it over to Miami.
[Rosello] '81, Willy and Sal were already big.
translation.ko: 1981년 윌리와 살은 이미 거물이 돼 있었죠

translation.en: Justo Jay was the one that took care of the loads that came in.
He took care of the stash houses. He used to take care of everything.
translation.ko: 후스토가 은닉처를 비롯해 모든 걸 관리했죠

translation.en: He's like, "I'm gonna pick you up, I want you to help me do something there."
I get in the car. We get to the house.
He's like, "I need you to help me count some money."
He takes the money out of the safe,
tells me how to count money and how to keep ledgers.
translation.ko: 돈 세는 법과 장부를 관리하는 법을 가르쳐 줬어요

translation.en: There was times where we counted up to five million dollars
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 5백만 달러까지 세어본 적도 있어요

translation.en: twice a week.
And I was 15 years old.
If the counting machine would break, like five or six hours.
translation.ko: 돈 세는 기계가 5, 6시간 정도 고장 나면

translation.en: And the next day, my thumbs would be swollen from counting.
translation.ko: 손으로 세느라 다음 날은 엄지가 붓곤 했어요

translation.en: Growing up, you see your parents going through hard times,
and then you're in a room with three or four million dollars,
I mean, how are you gonna say no to that, you know?
[Jefede] Everyone at that time had a friend or a friend of a friend

translation.ko: 마약 사업에 손댄 사람은 누구든 벼락부자가 됐죠

translation.en: A lot of these kids, they're first-generation immigrants.
They thought this was their path to the American dream.
If you would've told us we were criminal, we would have laughed.
translation.ko: 누가 우리더러 범죄자라고 했다면 웃었을 겁니다

translation.en: We're 20-year-old kids! We're just having fun.
[announcer] And there he is, Justo Jay, Willy Falcon, doing a fine job in the Seahawk V-Bottom.
translation.ko: 시호크의 후스토와 윌리가 V형 보트로 질주하고 있습니다

translation.en: I'm very much responsible for them getting involved in racing.
I started racing boats.
One day, Willy came over, he saw all the fun we were having.
translation.ko: 어느 날 구경 나온 윌리가 재미있어 보이니까

translation.en: And he goes, "Hey, can we do this?" And we started a company.
[Rosello] Willy and Sal bought a boat company, Seahawk.
translation.ko: 윌리와 살이 보트 회사인 시호크를 매입했죠

translation.en: [young Linero] It's the hottest thing around. [reporter] It seems to be.
It was appealing to drug smugglers, 'cause it's an expensive sport.
[DeFede] Who else could afford it? The toys are more expensive, but they're toys, right?
translation.ko: - 누가 감당할 수 있겠어요? - 비싸도 장난감은 장난감이잖아요

translation.ko: 1년에 9번 경주를 한다고 치면 한 번에 백만 달러가 들어요

translation.ko: 마약상이 보트 경주를 왜 하려 하겠어요?

translation.en: How the hell you gonna justify
translation.ko: 실업자가 백만 달러짜리 경주를 한다는 사실을

translation.ko: 실업자가 백만 달러짜리 경주를 한다는 사실을 어떻게 정당화하겠어요?

translation.en: [Linero] Sal got a boat, and they went and they got another boat.
translation.ko: 살이 보트를 산 다음 한 대 더 구매했어요

translation.en: And forget about everybody else, the race was between Willy and Sal
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 신경 안 썼죠 윌리와 살의 경주였어요

translation.en: in different boats. That was the race.
[announcer] There you see it, Seahawk Two makes a move on Seahawk One.
Willy Falcon makes a bid for the lead over Sal Magluta and Sal answers the challenge.
translation.ko: 살 마글루타가 윌리 팔콘의 도전에 응하고 있죠

translation.en: [Rosello] And they had Taby, Recut,
Jay, and Ralph Linero.
They call him cabeza because he's got a big head.
The racing helmet, it had to be custom made 'cause none of them fit.
translation.ko: 경주용 헬멧이 맞질 않아 주문 제작 해야 했어요

translation.en: Sometimes when we finish a race,
we got a couple of planes coming in about a day with 400 keys.
translation.ko: 400kg을 실은 비행기 두어 대가 들어오곤 했어요

translation.en: [DeFede] Willy won one national title, Sal was a three-time champion.
translation.ko: 윌리는 전국 대회에서 우승했고 살은 챔피언을 세 번이나 했죠

translation.en: [Barroso] We won the world championship.
Man, that was the best feeling you ever had.
[announcer] There's your winner in the Open Class National Champions
translation.ko: 오픈 클래스 전국 선수권 대회 2년 연속 우승자입니다

translation.en: two years in a row, and in modified class before that.
translation.ko: 오픈 클래스 전국 선수권 대회 2년 연속 우승자입니다 그 전에 개조형에서도 우승했죠

translation.en: [DeFede] At one point,
two-thirds of the champions of the powerboat racing circuit
were also all either soon-to-be or had just been convicted drug smugglers.
translation.ko: 마약 밀수로 유죄 확정 됐거나 곧 그렇게 될 사람이었죠

translation.en: Certainly, when you finish racing, win, lose, or draw,
you come home to a beautiful family, so you can't really lose.
translation.ko: 돌아갈 행복한 가정이 있으니 져도 진 게 아니죠

translation.en: No way.
[Linero] It was the family business. I know that these guys will do
translation.ko: 가족 사업이었어요 그들이 날 위해 뭐든 할 거란 걸 알았죠

translation.en: whatever they could for me, and I would do whatever I could for them.
translation.ko: 그들이 날 위해 뭐든 할 거란 걸 알았죠 저도 마찬가지였고요

translation.en: [Rosello] Willy's wife, Alina, had three sisters. Sal's wife, Isabelita, had three sisters.
translation.ko: 윌리의 아내도 살의 아내도 여자 형제가 둘이었는데

translation.en: Their husbands or boyfriends worked for the company or had a connection.
translation.ko: 그들의 남편이나 애인도 회사 직원이거나 관련이 있었어요

translation.en: My daughter, Rachel, is married to Sal's nephew.
translation.ko: 제 딸 레이철은 살의 조카와 결혼했어요

translation.en: We're very close.
[reporter] Sal Magluta. A man who has more to smile about than just his race boat.
translation.ko: 살 마글루타 씨는 경주 외에도 웃을 일이 많습니다

translation.en: Who do we have here today?
[Sal] I have my oldest son, Chris,
my little twins, Michael and Michelle, a boy and a girl.
translation.ko: 쌍둥이인 마이클과 미셸이에요 얜 아들, 얜 딸이죠

translation.en: -And don't forget. -Oh, and the wife here, Isabel.
translation.ko: - 잊으시면 안 되죠 - 제 아내 이사벨이에요

translation.en: [Rosello] My little sister used to keep the books for Taby. She was 14 years old.
translation.ko: 제 여동생은 14살 때 타비 밑에서 장부 정리를 했어요

translation.en: I mean, it was something that was kept very into the family. No outsiders.
translation.ko: 그건 가족이 아닌 외부인에겐 절대 시키지 않는 일이었죠

translation.en: Bye!
Bye!
Bye! Bye!
[Rosello] We were a close family, we did everything together. I mean, everything.
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 무척 친했어요 뭐든 같이했죠

translation.en: We used to go to Vail twice, three times a year.
I mean, my family, my sister. I mean, we never had to pay for anything.
translation.ko: 우리 가족도 누나도 돈을 낼 필요가 전혀 없었죠

translation.en: [DeFede] Willy and Sal, what set them apart,
was that they really did view this as a business.
[Rosello] We referred to the organization as "the company."
It was run like any other business.
You're not running a drug empire. You're running a legitimate corporation.
translation.ko: 마약 제국이 아니라 합법적인 회사를 운영한 거죠

translation.en: And one of the products is cocaine.
We're nothing more than the Kennedys of the 21st century.
Basically, it's a Fortune 500 company run by a bunch of muchachos.
[DeFede] It was like "Muchachos Inc."
Ralph Linero was vice president of air operations.
translation.ko: 랄프 리네로는 항공 운항 부서 부사장

translation.en: Juan Barroso was the vice president of boats.
Justo Jay, a V.P. of distribution.
Willy's brother, Taby, was like an executive vice president.
And Willy and Sal, they were the CEOs.
Willy was more of a schmoozer.
He was the one who would work the edges
translation.ko: 사업 상대를 찾고 인맥을 형성하는 건

translation.en: and the personalities, made the connections.
Then Sal would come in
and actually negotiate the finer points of business.
That's the way Sal wanted it. He wanted the focus always to be on Willy.
translation.ko: 살이 그걸 원했죠 늘 윌리한테 초점이 맞춰지길 원했어요

translation.en: In case something happened, Willy would go down and he wouldn't.
[Rosello] Sal was taught numbers and the business.
[Linero] Sal was an accounting wizard.
[DeFede] He's making sure payments are being made on a regular basis,
that the organization kept moving, kept running, kept operating.
translation.ko: 조직이 계속 운영되고 발전을 거듭한 건

translation.en: That was Sal's responsibility.
That's why they worked. You need an enforcer and you need a good guy.
translation.ko: 그게 성공 비결이었어요 '나쁜 경찰/좋은 경찰' 전략요

translation.en: Sal would use La Finquita, the farm in Miami, as the corporate headquarters.
translation.ko: 살은 마이애미에 있는 작은 농장 '라 핑키타'를 본부로 사용했어요

translation.en: [Linero] Sal had a tiger there.
We had a room full of short-wave radios to communicate with Colombia.
translation.ko: 콜롬비아와 통신할 때 쓰는 단파 무전기가 가득한 방도 있었죠

translation.en: [Rosello] Every six months, he would have everybody gathered there, all the clients.
I used to keep a daily ledger of the money and the coke.
translation.ko: 저는 돈과 코카인 양을 장부에 매일 기재했죠

translation.en: Everybody would be waiting there in the living room watching TV,
talking, taking hits, whatever.
[Linero] There was no board table. It was done with sweatsuits on.
translation.ko: 보드 테이블은 없었죠 땀복을 놓고 했어요

translation.en: [Rosello] They would call you one by one.
You walk in, you sit down in front of Sal. He's behind the desk.
translation.ko: 들어가면 책상을 가운데 두고 살 앞에 있는 의자에 앉았어요

translation.en: They had la silla caliente, the hot chair.
translation.ko: 그걸 '라 시야 칼리엔테' 뜨거운 의자라고 불렀죠

translation.en: 'Cause once you sit there, the truth has to come out. You can't fuck around.
translation.ko: 일단 앉으면 사실을 말해야지 헛짓하면 끝이었거든요

translation.en: Sal had the books, the ledgers, and he'll let you know how much money you owe
and the merchandise that you've taken and all that.
Sal and his books. He ran it like a legit business.
translation.ko: 살은 장부를 가지고 합법적인 사업처럼 운영했죠

translation.en: [reporter] You guys are making it sound like a Sunday drive.
Oh, yes, it was nice.
[DeFede] The hardest thing about being a drug dealer in Miami
in the '70s and early '80s was what to do with the money.
translation.ko: 1970년대 후반과 1980년대 초반 마이애미 마약상한테 고충은 벌어들인 돈을 어떻게 쓰느냐였죠

translation.en: I had ten million dollars in a big… Like a U-Haul box inside the closet.
translation.ko: 큰 이삿짐 상자 안에 천만 달러를 넣어 옷장에 뒀죠

translation.en: My mom told this friend from the family, "I wanna clean Pegy's room."
translation.ko: 엄마가 제 방을 청소한다며 가족 친구를 불렀어요

translation.en: "There's this big box I need to move. I need you to help me."
translation.ko: '아주 큰 상자가 있는데 혼자선 못 옮기겠어'

translation.en: They open the closet, both of them are pulling and tugging on the box.
translation.ko: 그분들이 제 옷장을 열고 상자를 잡아당기자

translation.en: The box breaks, all this money falls.
My mom sees that. Boom, she's fainted on the floor.
"What the hell is this? There's all this money in your closet."
translation.ko: '대체 이게 뭐야? 네 옷장에 돈이 쌓였어'

translation.en: "Your mom just fainted. We were trying to move the box."
[DeFede] The money was the biggest problem.
translation.ko: 돈이 가장 큰 문제였어요 상자에 담아서

translation.en: You can only box it up and keep it in your basement for so long.
translation.ko: 돈이 가장 큰 문제였어요 상자에 담아서 지하실에 보관한들 한계가 있었거든요

translation.en: Falcon and Magluta had purchased a great number of properties
and had used their fathers, their respective fathers,
to act as presidents of construction companies
that built apartment buildings in the Miami area.
[Rosello] They used to live in mansions, vacation homes, and Vail.
translation.ko: 그들은 저택, 별장 베일에서 살곤 했죠

translation.en: Sal had an apartment in Brickell Key, we used to call it Scarface.
translation.ko: 브리켈키에 있는 살의 아파트를 우린 '스카페이스'라고 불렀어요

translation.en: We would go out and party and Sal gave us an extra key.
After clubbing and stuff, we would go and hang out at Scarface.
They will go out to party at a club or whatever to spend 20, 30 grand a night.
translation.ko: 클럽이든 어디든 파티만 했다 하면 하룻밤에 2, 3만 달러를 썼는데

translation.en: That was like, nothing.
Willy and Sal, they used to party at The Mutiny all the time.
translation.ko: 윌리와 살은 뮤터니란 클럽에서 늘 파티하곤 했어요

translation.en: [Bonachea] If you were anybody, you'd be at The Mutiny.
translation.ko: 좀 한다고 하는 사람은 다 뮤터니에 모였죠

translation.en: That's where every drug dealer went.
[Linero] I would describe The Mutiny as the Wall Street
of cocaine business in the '80s.
That's where everything happened.
It was not my thing.
Too many fools. Cocaine on the fucking tables
with the women all around. What are you, crazy?
[Linero] We had a way to let other organizations know that we had material.
translation.ko: 타 조직에 코카인의 존재를 알리는 우리만의 방법이 있었어요

translation.en: We would get a Burger King hat. We would put it on the table.
That was a sign to everybody in the club that, "Hey, we got material."
translation.ko: 그건 클럽에 있는 사람들에게 이런 의미였어요, '약이 있어'

translation.en: "Let's talk."
I went looking for Willy to get me my money.
translation.ko: 윌리한테 돈을 받으러 간 적이 있어요

translation.en: And they had a party at The Mutiny. They were celebrating Cabeza's birthday.
translation.ko: 뮤터니에서 카베사의 생일 축하 파티를 한 다음

translation.en: And I found Willy, Sal, and Jay
stoned out of their minds in a room at the hotel.
translation.ko: 호텔 방에서 약에 잔뜩 취해 있는데

translation.en: And there was three girls in the bed, naked.
So I said, "The girls or the money?" So I jumped right in.
translation.ko: 돈 대신 여자로 받겠다고 하곤 곧바로 뛰어들었죠

translation.en: [Rosello] Willy and Sal were married, but you have money,
you wanna go out, party with your friends.
You think your wife… She could get mad for a day or two.
You get home, you give her 30, 40, 50 grand
and you tell her, "Go shopping." She's not gonna be mad at you anymore.
translation.ko: 남편이 5만 달러를 주며 쇼핑하라는데 화가 안 풀릴 사람이 어딨겠어요?

translation.en: [Linero] If they had a boat race, I would fly either the mistress or the wife
translation.ko: 보트 경주가 열리면 제가 그 둘의 아내나 정부를 데려다주는데

translation.en: and then the mistress would go on another plane in another hotel.
translation.ko: 아내가 오면 정부는 비행기에 태워 다른 호텔로 보내야 했죠

translation.en: It was a comedy of errors sometimes.
[Rosello] Outside his marriage, Willy had kids with this girl.
They had twins.
"Here's $50,000 to go shopping." I guess that probably cost Willy
translation.ko: 외도에 5만 달러가 드니까 그런 일엔 아마도

translation.en: probably a million. [chuckles]
[DeFede] These two guys were running the place. Everywhere you went, it was Willy and Sal.
translation.ko: 그 둘은 그곳의 제왕이었어요 사방에 윌리와 살이었죠

translation.en: [Rosello] If you didn't know Willy and Sal personally,
you knew someone that knew someone that knew Willy and Sal.
translation.ko: 한 다리만 건너면 모두가 윌리나 살의 친구였죠

translation.en: All of Miami considered them local heroes
because they were like Robin Hoods. They always shared their wealth.
[Rosello] At Miami High, I was on the basketball team.
Whatever the team needed, they got it.
translation.ko: 필요한 게 뭐든 윌리와 살이 조달했죠

translation.en: I mean, you go to them, "I need 30 grand, 40 grand to put my kid through college."
translation.ko: 아이를 대학에 보내는 데 3, 4만 달러가 필요하다고 하면

translation.en: "What do you need, 30? Here's 50."
They helped everybody.
[Bonachea] I hadn't seen Sal since 1979.
Sal called me, he said, "I wanna see you tonight."
He says, "Do you remember what car I was driving when we last were together?"
translation.ko: 마지막으로 만났을 때 무슨 차를 몰았는지 기억하냐길래

translation.en: I said, "Yeah, you were driving a blue Challenger."
And he says, "Okay. Watch what I'm gonna pick you up in."
translation.ko: 그러자 이번엔 어떤 차인지 잘 보라더군요

translation.en: He came and he picked me up and he's in a Rolls-Royce.
We were out in the Rolls
and we were going through…
You know Coconut Grove has a bad neighborhood on one side?
translation.ko: 그쪽에 안 좋은 동네가 있는 거 아세요?

translation.en: And Sal goes, "You see all these people? I support them."
translation.ko: 살이 말했어요 '이 사람들 보여? 내가 도와줘'

translation.en: "They get all their drugs from me." I said, "Great."
Then right behind us, I see sirens. And I go, "Oh, man."
translation.ko: 그러는데 사이렌이 울렸어요 큰일 났다 싶었죠

translation.en: I think he had a couple of keys in the back.
So I go, "Okay. We're all going to jail today."
There were two cops. They come out of the car.
They looked at Sal and never said,
"Can I have your driver's license?" or anything. They knew who he was.
translation.ko: 면허증을 요구하지 않았어요 누군지 이미 알더군요

translation.en: Sal says, "Look, we'll do a trade. You take the keys and you let me go."
translation.ko: 살이 말했죠, '코카인을 줄 테니 우린 그냥 보내줘요'

translation.en: And the cops turn around and said,
"It was nice running into you."
Took the two keys and took off.
And that was the end of that and I was like… [gasps]
[DeFede] In a lot of ways, Willy and Sal, in their world, in their community…
translation.ko: 그쪽 세상에선 윌리나 살이 글로리아 에스테판이나

translation.en: More popular than Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine.
[DeFede] They were the kings of cocaine in South Florida.
[Posada] They were grossing 20, 30 million every month.
I told Willy, "You already have over 100 million dollars.
translation.ko: 제가 윌리에게 말했죠 '이미 1억 달러 넘게 벌었잖아'

translation.en: Why don't you quit?"
And he said, "Until I get to a billion,
I'm not gonna quit."
The Miami area has the highest murder rate per capita in the country.
translation.ko: 마이애미 지역은 미국에서 1인당 살인율이 가장 높습니다

translation.en: [reporter 1] The rate of killing here is accelerating, the efficient work of the Cocaine Cowboys.
translation.ko: 코카인 카우보이의 효율적 작업에 살인율이 증가하고 있습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Local homicide detectives say Miami's in the middle of a narcotics war
translation.ko: 현지 강력계 형사들에 따르면 콜롬비아와 쿠바 마약상들이

translation.en: between Colombian and Cuban drug dealers.
translation.ko: 마이애미에서 마약 전쟁을 벌이고 있다고 합니다

translation.en: [DeFede] The violence, the shootings, the police were totally overwhelmed
and so they focused their limited resources on the violent drug dealers.
The ones who were embarrassing them because of headlines in the newspapers.
translation.ko: 신문 헤드라인을 통해 경찰에게 모욕을 준 마약상들요

translation.en: But not Willy and Sal.
[Clark] Falcon and Magluta, they weren't necessarily on the radar screen.
translation.ko: 팔콘과 마글루타는 딱히 관심의 대상이 아니었어요

translation.en: They were the nonviolent drug dealers.
[Linero] If I would say, "Hey, I lost a load."
I wouldn't be in fear of say, "Hey, I don't want to get killed."
My word was just good enough for them.
[DeFede] It wasn't about retaliation. It was about taking care of business.
Violence attracts more attention to you. That's not what they wanted.
You're in the drug business and when you're that big, of course it's dangerous.
translation.ko: 마약 사업 규모가 그렇게 큰데 당연히 위험하죠

translation.en: Kind of a stressful lifestyle, but…
The sport itself isn't dangerous as long as you're well-prepared,
translation.ko: 스포츠 자체는 위험하지 않아요 준비를 철저히 하고 훌륭한 팀원들이 협력하는 한

translation.en: you got a good crew, and they're all working together.
translation.ko: 준비를 철저히 하고 훌륭한 팀원들이 협력하는 한

translation.en: You… I don't see any danger in it.
[reporter 1] A federal task force is helping Florida
reduce the drug tide, now estimated at seven billion dollars a year.
translation.ko: 플로리다로 유입되는 걸 막기 위해 연방 전담반이 나섰습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Cocaine seizures are up. 12,000 pounds of coke seized in 1983,
compared with 44,000 pounds of coke taken last year.
Drugs weren't coming in like they used to.
[reporter 2] The efforts by the Drug Task Force has officials in other parts of the country
translation.ko: 이곳 마약 전담반의 노력으로 밀수업자들이 대마초와 코카인을

translation.en: saying now they have increased problems with drug smugglers
translation.ko: 마이애미가 아닌 다른 지역을 통해 유입함에 따라

translation.en: moving marijuana and cocaine through other places.
translation.ko: 마이애미가 아닌 다른 지역을 통해 유입함에 따라 해당 지역에서 문제가 증가했다는 소식입니다

translation.en: Places away from Miami.
That put a stop on the operation, and then it was,
translation.ko: 그 일로 우리 사업에 차질이 생겨

translation.en: "We gotta go back to plan B."
Plan B was to move to California.
[Rosello] In '85, Willy and Sal, they left to L.A.
[Clark] They set up shop in Marina del Rey, an affluent suburb of Los Angeles.
translation.ko: 부유한 교외 마리나 델 레이에서 사업을 시작했죠

translation.en: Willy's like, "Stay in L.A., count money, start working for the company,
translation.ko: 윌리가 제게 LA에서 지내면서 돈도 세고 회사 일을 하면

translation.en: I'll pay you $5,000 a week."
California was the equivalent of Miami at that time.
translation.ko: 그 당시 캘리포니아는 마이애미와 다를 게 없었죠

translation.en: Drugs were being transported across the southwestern border.
translation.ko: 마약이 남서부 국경을 넘어 유입되고 있었어요

translation.en: [Rosello] The difference between East and West Coast,
translation.ko: 동부 해안과 서부 해안의 차이점은 이거예요

translation.en: East, you bring it up by plane and speedboats.
West Coast, tractor trailers.
I think that once everything started in L.A. in '85, things got out of control.
translation.ko: 1985년 LA에서 모든 게 시작되자 상황은 걷잡을 수 없게 됐어요

translation.en: They were bringing in anywhere from three to five thousand keys
on a monthly basis.
[Clark] Because of their high-living lifestyle, this drew the attention of bystanders
translation.ko: 그들의 화려한 생활 방식은 구경꾼들의 관심을 끌었고

translation.en: and information was related to
the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, Narcotics Squad.
translation.ko: LA 카운티 보안관국의 마약 단속반에 전달됐죠

translation.en: They executed a raid and discovered
a treasure trove of incriminating evidence.
Large amount of cash, three kilograms of cocaine,
fake identification. And based upon that bust, Falcon and Magluta,
translation.ko: 가짜 신분증을요 그 급습으로 팔콘과 마글루타는

translation.en: under their assumed identities,
were arrested again on state trafficking charges.
They were issued bond under their fake names.
Law enforcement wasn't really in tune with how to capture and go after these guys.
translation.ko: 법 집행기관은 그들을 체포하는 법을 잘 알지 못했어요

translation.en: They'd get arrested.
You just change your ID, get new driver's licenses,
translation.ko: 그들은 체포되면 신분증을 바꾸고 운전 면허증을 새로 발급받은 뒤 보석 중에 사라졌죠

translation.en: you skip bail.
translation.ko: 운전 면허증을 새로 발급받은 뒤 보석 중에 사라졌죠

translation.en: And that's what they ended up doing.
translation.ko: 그때도 그렇게 했어요 LA에서 보석으로 풀려나자

translation.en: Once you make bond in L.A., they're gone.
